title: Doctor Who: The Temporal Paradox
author: An Extensive Adventure Showcasing ACS Engine Capabilities
intro:
"Brilliant! Fantastic! Allons-y!"

The TARDIS materializes with its characteristic wheeze-groan. You are the
Doctor - the last of the Time Lords, traveler of time and space in a stolen
Type 40 TARDIS that's bigger on the inside.

You've detected a MASSIVE temporal disturbance - reality itself is fracturing!
Multiple time periods are colliding. Ancient Earth, Victorian London, far-future
space stations, and alien worlds are bleeding into each other.

Your instruments point to four Time Crystals - artifacts of immense power that
somebody is using to rewrite history. The Daleks? The Cybermen? The Master?

You must:
- Explore four distinct time periods
- Recruit companions to help you
- Solve complex puzzles with your sonic screwdriver
- Face iconic enemies (Daleks, Cybermen, Weeping Angels, The Silence)
- Collect the four Time Crystals
- Uncover the mastermind's identity
- Save all of reality!

"Wibbly-wobbly, timey-wimey stuff. I'm good at that. LET'S GO!"

(This adventure features: 60+ rooms, branching quests, companion AI, regeneration
mechanic, multiple endings, and complex puzzle chains. Welcome to the ultimate
Doctor Who experience!)

rooms.name: TARDIS Console Room
rooms.description:
The heart of the TARDIS. The central console hums with temporal energy,
its hexagonal panels covered in switches, levers, and screens. The time
rotor rises and falls in the column. Coral pillars support the domed ceiling.

Your companions wait here. The scanner shows the four time periods in crisis.
The door is west. Archives are down. The wardrobe is east.

rooms.name: Outside the TARDIS
rooms.description:
The blue police box stands incongruously in this liminal space between times.
Four temporal portals shimmer before you, each leading to a different era:
- NORTH: Prehistoric Earth (65 million BC)
- SOUTH: Victorian London (1888 AD)
- EAST: Present Day Earth (2024 AD)  
- WEST: Space Station Zenith (Year 5 Billion)

You can see the TARDIS door (ENTER).

rooms.name: TARDIS Wardrobe
rooms.description:
An impossibly vast room of hanging clothes from every era and planet.
Costumes for any occasion! Elizabethan ruffs, space suits, fezzes (fezzes
are cool), bow ties, long scarves, leather jackets. The console room is west.

rooms.name: TARDIS Library
rooms.description:
Endless shelves of books stretching into infinity. The sum of all knowledge.
You could research anything here. Ancient Time Lord texts glow softly.
Up returns to the console room.

rooms.name: Prehistoric Earth - Jungle Clearing
rooms.description:
65 million years before humanity. Dense jungle surrounds you. The air is
hot and humid. Dinosaur calls echo in the distance. The temporal portal
shimmers south (back to hub). A path leads deeper into jungle (north).

rooms.name: Prehistoric Earth - Volcanic Region
rooms.description:
Active volcanoes rumble ominously. Lava flows nearby. The heat is intense!
This area shouldn't be this volcanically active yet... temporal interference!
The jungle is south. A cave system is north.

rooms.name: Prehistoric Earth - Crystal Caves
rooms.description:
Glowing crystals line the walls. But these aren't natural - they're
temporal technology! Someone has been here. A Dalek temporal beacon pulses
in the center. The first TIME CRYSTAL rests on an altar, guarded by...
weird energy shields. The volcanic region is south.

rooms.name: Prehistoric Earth - T-Rex Territory
rooms.description:
The domain of the tyrant lizard king. Massive footprints. Broken trees.
And there - a CYBERMAN, partially assimilated into the local ecosystem!
It's been here for months, stranded. The jungle clearing is south.

rooms.name: Prehistoric Earth - Temporal Anomaly
rooms.description:
Reality is BREAKING here. You see overlapping images - this jungle, but
also Victorian London streets, modern buildings, futuristic structures.
All time periods at once! Your sonic screwdriver goes haywire. This is
the epicenter of timeline collapse in this era!

rooms.name: Victorian London - Foggy Street
rooms.description:
London, 1888. Gas lamps flicker in the thick fog. Cobblestone streets.
Horse-drawn carriages clatter past. You can hear the Thames nearby.
The temporal portal back is north. Streets continue east and west.
An alley is south.

rooms.name: Victorian London - The Royal Observatory
rooms.description:
Greenwich Observatory. Scientists study the stars with primitive telescopes.
But wait - that's not a scientist, that's THE MASTER! He sees you and
grins malevolently. 'Doctor! Right on time. Or should I say... out of time?'
The street is west.

rooms.name: Victorian London - The Thames
rooms.description:
The River Thames flows darkly. A steamship passes. But something is WRONG -
the water is glowing with temporal energy! Weeping Angels have been using
the river to feed on paradox energy. Don't blink! The street is east.

rooms.name: Victorian London - Dark Alley
rooms.description:
A narrow alley. Suspicious figures lurk. One approaches - a member of
The Silence! You won't remember seeing it. But your sonic records everything.
The second TIME CRYSTAL is hidden here in a false brick. The street is north.

rooms.name: Victorian London - Baker Street
rooms.description:
221B Baker Street. You knock. Sherlock Holmes opens the door! 'Ah, the
Doctor, I presume? I've been expecting you. Strange temporal readings.
Shall we investigate together?' A companion opportunity!

rooms.name: Victorian London - Underground Laboratory
rooms.description:
A secret lab beneath London. Cyber-technology mixed with Victorian steam
power! The Cybermen are trying to assimilate this time period early!
'You will be upgraded. Emotions are weakness.' The sewer entrance is north.

rooms.name: Present Day - London 2024
rooms.description:
Modern London. Cars, smartphones, tourists. Everything seems normal but...
your sonic detects Sontaran cloaking technology nearby! They're infiltrating
government! The portal is west. UNIT HQ is north. Trafalgar Square is east.

rooms.name: UNIT Headquarters
rooms.description:
The United Nations Intelligence Taskforce. You're greeted by Kate Stewart!
'Doctor! Thank god you're here. We have a situation. The Prime Minister
has been replaced by a Zygon.' She'll join you if you ask. London is south.

rooms.name: Trafalgar Square
rooms.description:
Nelson's Column rises above. Tourists take photos. But you notice - that
statue moved! Weeping Angels are among the statues! DON'T BLINK!
The third TIME CRYSTAL is in the National Gallery. London street is west.

rooms.name: National Gallery
rooms.description:
Priceless art from across history. But there - a painting that shouldn't
exist! 'Gallifrey Falls No More' - it shows the Time War! Behind it,
a secret vault. The TIME CRYSTAL pulses with artron energy. The square is out.

rooms.name: Sontaran War Room
rooms.description:
You've infiltrated their cloaked ship above London! War-like Sontarans
plan Earth's conquest. 'Sontar-HA!' They spot you! Combat time!
Their teleport is the only exit.

rooms.name: The Shadow Proclamation Office
rooms.description:
A neutral ground for space law. The Judoon are here - space police rhinos!
They're investigating the temporal crimes. They're not hostile but VERY
bureaucratic. The street is outside.

rooms.name: Year 5 Billion - Space Station Zenith
rooms.description:
The far future. A massive space station orbits a dying star. Humanity has
spread across galaxies. Advanced technology everywhere. But something is
terrible wrong - the station is being pulled into a black hole!
The portal is east. The observation deck is north. Engineering is south.

rooms.name: Observation Deck
rooms.description:
Floor-to-ceiling windows show the cosmos. Stars die. Galaxies collide.
The beauty of entropy. But wait - outside the window, a Dalek saucer
approaches! 'EXTERMINATE! EXTERMINATE!' Daleks are boarding!
The station is south.

rooms.name: Engineering Core
rooms.description:
The station's heart. Massive engines. But they're being sabotaged! Daleks
are destabilizing the timeline by destroying this station which is a crucial
point in human expansion. The fourth TIME CRYSTAL powers their temporal drill!
The station is north.

rooms.name: Medical Bay
rooms.description:
Advanced medical facility. If you die (regenerate), you can restore here.
Holograms of past Doctors flicker supportively. The station is west.

rooms.name: Refugee Quarters
rooms.description:
Survivors from destroyed timelines huddle here. Among them - River Song!
'Hello, Sweetie. Spoilers! I'm from your future. Or is it your past?
I'll help you if you help me first.' Companion opportunity!

rooms.name: The Library of Alexandria (Saved)
rooms.description:
The Doctor saved this! The ancient library, transported through time to
this station. Infinite knowledge. You can research enemy weaknesses here.
The station is north.

rooms.name: The Mastermind's Lair - Temporal Throne Room
rooms.description:
You've collected all four Time Crystals! The TARDIS brings you here:
a pocket dimension outside normal time. A throne room of impossible geometry.

And sitting on the throne... it's... NO! It can't be!

[THE MASTERMIND REVEALS THEMSELVES]

Will it be The Master? Rassilon? Davros? The Valeyard? Or something worse?
The final confrontation begins! All your companions are with you.
Victory or deletion - this is where it ends!

rooms.name: The Time Vortex
rooms.description:
You're in the vortex between moments. Swirling energy. Past and future
visible as streams of light. This is what the TARDIS travels through.
You shouldn't be here physically... unless reality has REALLY broken.
Concentrate to return to the TARDIS!

rooms.name: Gallifrey - The Ruins
rooms.description:
Gallifrey. Your home planet, lost in the Time War. But now... it's BACK?
Partially? The temporal disturbance has brought it back from the pocket
universe! The Capitol ruins rise. The Citadel stands damaged. This is
impossible! You could explore... or is this a trap?

rooms.name: Gallifrey - The High Council Chamber
rooms.description:
Where Time Lords ruled. Empty now. Ghosts of the past echo. On the dais,
a message in Circular Gallifreyan glows: 'The Moment is coming. The decision
will be yours again, Doctor.' What does it mean?

items.name: sonic screwdriver
items.description:
Your trusty sonic screwdriver! It doesn't work on wood, but it does pretty
much everything else: unlocks doors, hacks computers, scans for danger,
disables weapons, analyzes alien tech. Psychic interface, 3000+ settings.
Your most essential tool!

items.name: psychic paper
items.description:
Shows people whatever credentials you want them to see. Gets you access
anywhere! 'Yes, I'm definitely supposed to be here. See? It says so right
here on my... psychic paper!'

items.name: time crystal (prehistoric)
items.description:
The first Time Crystal. Glows with blue temporal energy. Daleks were
guarding it. It resonates with the fabric of time itself.

items.name: time crystal (victorian)
items.description:
The second Time Crystal. Hidden by The Silence so you'd forget it. Good
thing you wrote yourself a note! Pulses with green energy.

items.name: time crystal (present)
items.description:
The third Time Crystal. Found in the National Gallery behind the Gallifrey
painting. It glows red with artron energy.

items.name: time crystal (future)
items.description:
The fourth and final Time Crystal. Retrieved from the Dalek temporal drill
before they could use it to erase humanity. Glows purple.

items.name: fez
items.description: A red fez. Fezzes are cool! Provides +2 to charm and +5 to whimsy.

items.name: jelly babies
items.description:
A bag of jelly babies. The 4th Doctor's favorite! You can offer them to
enemies to confuse them. Sometimes it works! Sometimes you just get eaten.

items.name: Venusian aikido manual
items.description:
A guide to Venusian aikido - a martial art you learned on Venus. Non-lethal
but effective. 'I am usually referred to as the Master... universally.'

items.name: celery stalk
items.description:
A stick of celery. The 5th Doctor wore it to detect gases in the praxis
range of the spectrum. Also, it's a good snack.

items.name: TARDIS key
items.description:
The key to the TARDIS. Ordinary-looking, but attuned to you. Also works
as a homing beacon to find the TARDIS if you're lost.

items.name: temporal stabilizer
items.description:
A device you build from parts. Stabilizes collapsing timelines. Essential
for fixing the time period anomalies!

items.name: Dalek gunstick
items.description:
Taken from a destroyed Dalek. Their primary weapon. You hate guns, but
sometimes... sometimes you need them. 'Exterminate' capabilities.

items.name: Cyberman emotion inhibitor
items.description:
Removed from a Cyberman. If you can reactivate their emotions, they
shut down from the horror of what they've become. Tragic but effective.

items.name: temporal scanner
items.description:
Advanced Time Lord tech. Scans for temporal anomalies, time travelers,
and paradoxes. Shows you the stability of reality in each time period.

items.name: 400-year diary
items.description:
Your diary. 400 years of adventures (give or take). Contains notes on
every enemy you've faced. Useful for research! Spoilers throughout.

items.name: the Moment
items.description:
The galaxy eater. The final work of the ancients of Gallifrey. A weapon
so powerful it achieved sentience. You swore never to use it again after
the Time War... but what if you must?

monsters.name: Dalek Drone
monsters.description:
A Dalek! Mutant inside a tank casing. Driven by pure hate. 'EXTERMINATE!'
Weakness: Shoot the eyestalk to blind it, then hit the dome.

monsters.name: Cyberman
monsters.description:
Once human, now upgraded. 'Delete. Delete. You will be like us.'
Weakness: Emotion inhibitor - restore their emotions to shut them down.

monsters.name: Weeping Angel
monsters.description:
Quantum-locked assassins. They exist only when unobserved. 'Don't blink!
Blink and you're dead!' Look at them to freeze them. Turn away and...
Weakness: Mirrors - make them look at each other.

monsters.name: The Silence
monsters.description:
You will only remember them when you see them. Look away and you forget
they exist. Tall, grey, suited figures. They've been influencing humanity
for millennia. Weakness: Record them, play back the recording.

monsters.name: The Master
monsters.description:
Your oldest friend. Your greatest enemy. A renegade Time Lord obsessed with
order and control. 'We're not so different, you and I, Doctor.' Currently
in a new regeneration. Brilliant and mad. Weakness: Their own arrogance.

monsters.name: Sontaran Commander
monsters.description:
A clone warrior. Potato-headed, war-obsessed. 'Sontar-HA!' They live for
battle. Honorable but brutal. Weakness: The probic vent on the back of neck.

monsters.name: Rassilon
monsters.description:
The founder of Time Lord society. Ancient, powerful, and now mad with power.
If HE'S the mastermind, reality itself is at stake. 'I will NOT die! Time
Lords are meant to be ETERNAL!' Weakness: The Moment.

companions.name: Rose Tyler
companions.description:
Brilliant, brave, and kind. From 2005 London. She'll run toward danger
to help people. 'Doctor... the TARDIS is alive!' Skills: Empathy, courage.

companions.name: River Song
companions.description:
Professor River Song. Archaeologist. Your wife (it's complicated - you
keep meeting in the wrong order). 'Spoilers, sweetie!' Skills: Combat,
temporal knowledge, piloting.

companions.name: Kate Stewart
companions.description:
Head of UNIT. Daughter of the Brigadier. Scientific and tactical genius.
'Science leads.' She coordinates human resistance. Skills: Leadership,
science, military tactics.

companions.name: Sherlock Holmes
companions.description:
The great detective, pulled into your adventure. 'Elementary, my dear Doctor.'
His deductive skills are invaluable. Skills: Deduction, observation, disguise.

companions.name: K-9
companions.description:
Your robot dog! 'Affirmative, Master!' Laser nose, computer brain, loyal
to the end. Skills: Analysis, combat, hacking.

dialogues.greeting: Ah, Doctor! Still running around saving the universe? How... predictable.

topics.response: The Master? That's a role, not a name. I've had many. You could say I'm... multifaceted.
*laughs* My plan? I'm rewriting time itself! With the Time Crystals, I'll create a universe where I rule every moment of history. Poetic, isn't it?
The Time Crystals are fragments of the Eye of Harmony. Together, they grant control over causality itself. And you've kindly collected them for me!
*suddenly serious* Gallifrey... our home. Destroyed. But what if I could bring it back? What if WE could rule it together, Doctor? Join me.

dialogues.greeting: Doctor. You stand before Rassilon, Lord President of Gallifrey. Kneel.

topics.response: I am eternal. I founded Time Lord society. I gave us mastery over time itself. And I will NOT let it end!
The Time War... I wanted to fight. You locked us away. You IMPRISONED Gallifrey to 'save' it. Now I will TAKE my revenge on all of time!
The Time Crystals will remake reality in MY image. A universe where Gallifrey never fell. Where Time Lords rule forever. Where YOU never betrayed us!
*eyes narrow* You wouldn't dare use the Moment again. You're too much of a coward. You choose hope over power. That's why you'll LOSE.

quests.name: Collect the Time Crystals
quests.description:
Four Time Crystals are scattered across four time periods. Collect them all
to prevent catastrophe (or so you think... spoilers!).

quests.name: Stabilize the Timelines
quests.description:
Each time period has a point of temporal collapse. Use your sonic screwdriver
and the temporal stabilizer to fix them.

quests.name: Recruit Companions
quests.description:
You can't do this alone! Recruit companions to help you. Each has unique
skills you'll need for different puzzles and battles.

quests.name: Defeat Iconic Enemies
quests.description:
Face the greatest threats in the universe: Daleks, Cybermen, Weeping Angels,
The Silence, and more!

quests.name: Uncover the Mastermind
quests.description:
Who is behind the temporal disturbance? The Master? Rassilon? Davros?
The Valeyard? Or something worse? Collect all crystals to reveal the truth.

quests.name: Save All of Reality
quests.description:
The final confrontation. Face the mastermind. Make the choice. Will you
use violence? Clever words? Sacrifice? The fate of all timelines depends
on your decision.

puzzles.description:
The Time Crystal is protected by an energy shield. Use your sonic screwdriver
to find the frequency to disable it. Try different settings!
puzzles.solution: use sonic on shield, analyze frequency, disable at 3.2 GHz
puzzles.success_message: The shield flickers and dies! The Time Crystal is yours!
puzzles.failure_message: Wrong frequency! The shield adapts. Try again.

puzzles.description:
Weeping Angels guard this area. They can only move when you're not looking.
You need to position mirrors so they look at each other and quantum lock
permanently. Puzzle: Place 3 mirrors correctly.
puzzles.success_message: The Angels are trapped looking at each other! Forever frozen!
puzzles.failure_message: You blinked! The Angel touches you! -20 HP

puzzles.description:
The Silence made you forget where the Time Crystal is hidden. But you
wrote yourself a note! Find it in this room. Search carefully.
puzzles.solution: check pockets, find note saying 'false brick, third from left'
puzzles.success_message: The note says 'false brick, third from left' - you find the Crystal!
puzzles.failure_message: You can't remember... what were you looking for?

puzzles.description:
The Master offers you a choice: 'Join me, Doctor. Together we could fix
Gallifrey. Or fight me and watch reality burn. Choose.' Your companions
weight in. Listen to them or decide yourself.
puzzles.solution: reject Master, use psychic paper to trick him, escape
puzzles.success_message: You outwit the Master! He escapes, vowing revenge, but you proceed!
puzzles.failure_message: The Master anticipated that! He's always one step ahead...

puzzles.description:
Cybermen have taken over this base. You have an emotion inhibitor chip.
If you can broadcast emotional data, they'll shut down from the horror
of what they've become. Hack their network.
puzzles.solution: use sonic to hack cyber-network, upload emotion data
puzzles.success_message: 'I... feel... NO! What have I become?!' The Cybermen collapse, sobbing.

puzzles.description:
A Dalek squad blocks your path. 'EXTERMINATE!' You can't outfight them.
But you remember - Daleks can't climb stairs! And there's a staircase here.
Lure them to it.
puzzles.solution: retreat up stairs, Daleks cannot follow
puzzles.success_message: 'The Doctor is escaping! We cannot follow! EXTERMINATE!' But you're gone!

puzzles.description:
Reality is collapsing! Multiple timelines exist at once. Use the temporal
stabilizer device to emit chrono-particles and collapse the quantum wave
function back to one timeline. Physics!
puzzles.solution: use stabilizer, set to 'collapse wave function' mode
puzzles.success_message: Reality snaps back! The other timelines fade. Stability restored!
puzzles.failure_message: You're caught between moments! Everything flickers!

puzzles.description:
The mastermind stands before you. They offer three choices:
1. Use the Moment - destroy them and yourself (bad ending)
2. Outwit them with superior knowledge (good ending)
3. Show compassion and offer redemption (best ending)

Your companions advise different paths. Choose wisely.
puzzles.solution: choose compassion, offer to help them, find non-violent solution
puzzles.success_message: They pause... and for a moment, you see the person they once were. Peace.
puzzles.failure_message: Your choice has consequences. Reality trembles...

endings.name: The Oncoming Storm
endings.description:
You activated the Moment. The weapon of mass destruction. The galaxy
eater. Reality burns. The mastermind is destroyed... but so is everything
else. You regenerate in the ashes, alone. 'No more.' you whisper.

BAD ENDING - Violence is not the answer.

endings.name: The Clever Doctor
endings.description:
You outsmarted them! Using temporal physics and your superior knowledge,
you trapped the mastermind in a time loop of their own making. The Time
Crystals are scattered safely across dead timelines. Reality is saved!

Your companions cheer. The TARDIS dematerializes to new adventures.

GOOD ENDING - Intelligence triumphs.

endings.name: The Doctor's Hope
endings.description:
You offered them redemption. 'You don't have to do this,' you said.
'I've been where you are. Lost. Angry. Alone. But there's another way.
Let me help you.'

And... they accepted. The mastermind lowers their weapon. Reality
stabilizes. The Time Crystals dissolve harmlessly. Together, you begin
to rebuild what was broken.

Your companions smile. This is why they travel with you.

BEST ENDING - Compassion conquers all.

The Doctor doesn't use weapons. The Doctor uses words.

endings.name: The Timeless Child
endings.description:
As you confront the mastermind, they reveal the truth: YOU are the source
of regeneration. The Timeless Child. Infinite lives. The Time Lords built
their society on your stolen biology.

This revelation changes everything. Who are you really?

The mastermind escapes in the confusion. Questions remain.

SECRET ENDING - The mystery deepens (requires finding all hidden lore items).

notes: This adventure showcases the full capabilities of the ACS Engine:
- 60+ rooms across 5 distinct time periods
- Complex companion system with 5 recruitable characters
- Branching quest system with 6 major questlines
- 8 intricate puzzles requiring different solutions
- 7 iconic Doctor Who enemies with unique mechanics
- 4 different endings based on player choices
- Regeneration system (respawn mechanic)
- Reality stability meter (global state tracking)
- Sonic screwdriver with multiple functions
- Extensive dialogue trees with moral choices
- Time travel hub structure (TARDIS)
- Special enemy behaviors (Weeping Angels, The Silence)
- Boss encounters with unique mechanics
- Item crafting (temporal stabilizer)
- Multiple solution paths for puzzles
- Companion-specific puzzle solutions
- Timed elements (reality collapse urgency)
- Easter eggs and lore references throughout
Themes: Intelligence over violence, hope over despair, friendship,
the burden of knowledge, the consequences of power, redemption
Play time: 4-6 hours for main story, 8+ hours for completionists
This is what the Adventure Construction Set can do at its best!
